message: Do you know is there a place to resubmit this bug to be fixed at least in Core?

This post is regarding the full framework, where the bug was reported and closed as "won't fix".

For netcore, the bug was reported and marked as "up for grabs", so I submitted a pull request.
It's very difficult to review code in blog comments. What are the differences between this one and the one in my blog post?

It is your code, with some additions that were necessary to build using .NET Core.  
As a response to the previous comment.

It should already be fixed in .NET Core 2.0.0.

Here's the pull request: [https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/12682](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/12682)  
Here's the final wrapper as it exists in .NET Core v2: [https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.IO.Compression/tests/Utilities/WrappedStream.cs](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.IO.Compression/tests/Utilities/WrappedStream.cs)  
Here's a blog post I wrote about zipping on the fly on .NET Core v1: [https://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/11/streaming-zip-on-aspnet-core.html](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/11/streaming-zip-on-aspnet-core.html)  
And here's the code I used to get it working on v1: [https://github.com/StephenClearyExamples/AsyncDynamicZip/tree/core-ziparchive](https://github.com/StephenClearyExamples/AsyncDynamicZip/tree/core-ziparchive)

I'd just recommend using one of those wrappers.
